title: Functional management
overview: The course is designed to provide students with systematic knowledge about managing organizational activities, specifically covering organizational functions such as marketing, finance, human resources, production, R&D, and quality management.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Understanding the nature and philosophy of managing organizational functions
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to understand the fundamental theories and philosophies of managing organizational functions.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Applying management knowledge to organizational functions
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to apply management knowledge flexibly to manage organizational functions in a dynamic environment.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Soft skills such as teamwork, communication, negotiation, planning, and organization
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will develop soft skills such as teamwork, communication, negotiation, planning, and organization.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Analyzing organizational activities and performing management functions
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to analyze organizational activities and perform management functions in specific organizations.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Independent work, coordination, presenting, and defending personal views
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to work independently, coordinate activities, present, and defend personal views based on an objective and systematic approach.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Social context, management environment, professional ethics, and social responsibility
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will have an understanding of the social context, management environment, professional ethics, and social responsibility.
